official-title.#text: To establish an Elementary Educator Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) Content Coach program.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Elementary Educator STEM Content Coach Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (PCAST) and committees of the National Academies, have highlighted the need to raise student achievement in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) fields to enable the United States to maintain its competitive edge in the global economy.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Council of Advisors on Science and Technology

text.#text: Numerous recent reports by national advisory groups, including the President’s

quote.#tail: states, “The most important factor in ensuring excellence is great STEM teachers, with both deep content knowledge in STEM subjects and mastery of the pedagogical skills required to teach these subjects well.”.
quote.#text: Prepare and Inspire: K–12 Education in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) for America’s Future

text.#text: The PCAST report entitled
The PCAST report also recommends that the Federal Government should support the professional development of all teachers to help them achieve deep STEM content knowledge and mastery of STEM pedagogy.

The National Academy of Sciences finds that school districts need to enhance the capacity of kindergarten through grade 12 teachers with content knowledge and expertise in teaching in order to successfully promote effective STEM education in those grades.

The Center for American Progress finds that improving the elementary school teacher’s knowledge of STEM-related facts, concepts, and procedures is vital to our Nation’s global competitiveness in the 21st century.
The purpose of this Act is to create a cohort of elementary educators with a deep content knowledge in STEM disciplines by providing professional development to elementary educators.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary Educator STEM Content Coach Act/s:9

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall award grants to State educational agencies to award subgrants to eligible entities to carry out professional development training programs for STEM Coaches.

text.#text: From amounts appropriated under

header.#text: Elementary Educator STEM Content Coach grant program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the

text.#text: To be eligible to receive a grant under this Act, a State educational agency shall submit an application to the
a list of the eligible entities the State educational agency has selected to receive a subgrant under this program; and
assurances that the State educational agency has adopted college- and career-ready standards in STEM disciplines.

To be eligible to receive a subgrant under this Act, an eligible entity shall submit an application to the State educational agency at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the State educational agency may require, which shall include—
an identification of the number of STEM Coaches and the schools at which the STEM Coaches teach;
a description of the qualifications of the STEM Coaches;

assurances that the eligible entity will make reasonable efforts to place STEM Coaches that complete the professional development training program described in this section in positions at a school served by the local educational agency that receives the subgrant; and
a description of the plan for offering a research-based professional development training program to STEM Coaches, which may include—
training in STEM disciplines which may include science, technology, computer science, engineering design, mathematics, and computational thinking;
methods to integrate such disciplines into the curriculum;
methods to increase skills and knowledge of pedagogy for effective STEM teaching;

techniques for engaging historically underachieving or underrepresented groups in STEM fields, such as girls, minorities, low-income students, English language learners, and students with disabilities;
educational and instructional leadership training; and
opportunities for teacher mentoring and collaboration.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary Educator STEM Content Coach Act/s:6/ss:a/p:4

text.#text: The professional development training program described in
give STEM Coaches a deep understanding of the principles and concepts of STEM disciplines;
create enthusiasm for the teaching and learning of STEM disciplines;
provide opportunities for collaboration and teacher mentoring among STEM Coaches and between STEM Coaches and other teachers; and
allow STEM Coaches to connect student learning in STEM disciplines—
to real-life applications;
to out of school programs; and
across the curriculum.
An eligible entity awarded a subgrant under this Act shall conduct the professional development training program described in this section for a period of not less than 3 successive school years.

determines will result in full implementation of such program.
